page.title: 01Llansilin - Cynllaith Valley
page.content: The area covers a beautiful Welsh border valley with undulating valley floor 145m and steeply rising ridges Pentre Cyn on SE 317 "Coed Cochion" - the Red Wood - E - 362m and Bryn-ellyll NW 412. The Eastern slopes are partly covered in trees - deciduous and fir woods but the main crop is intensively farmed grass. Only 3 dairy farms, the rest beef and sheep mainly for suckler store cattle and fat or store lambs. The N part of the village of Llansilin has a preservation order on it - there are no outstanding buildings just a street of houses all different but nearly all joined up and a beautiful church, very old. SE of Llansilin barley and wheat grow well and one "small farm" in the area rear thousands of pheasants and partridges. There are miles of hedgerows and wild life flourishes.
